text:
Almena is a city in Norton County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 408 people lived there.
History.
Almena was a shipping point at the junction of two railroads. It was named by Margaret Brown Coleman. She named it after Almena, Wisconsin, her hometown.
The first post office in Almena was created in June 1872.
Geography.
Almena is at (39.891535, -99.708865). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 408 people, 180 households, and 102 families living in Almena.
Education.
Almena is part of USD 212 Northern Valley Schools. The Northern Valley High School mascot is Huskies.
